item.title: Supreme Court questions obstruction charge against Jan. 6 rioter, which could impact Trump
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Hurley and Ryan J. Reilly
item.description: The Supreme Court weighs whether Jan. 6 rioters can be charged with obstructing an official proceeding, which could bear on Trump's election interference case.

media:content.media:text: Trump supporters
media:content.media:description: Trump supporters in Washington, D.C., on Jan. 6, 2021.

item.title: Judge admonishes Trump after he appears to speak during questioning of a prospective juror
item.description: Jury selection continues in former president's hush money case

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump attends the second day of his trial at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York City
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump attends the second day of his trial at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York City, on April 16, 2024. (Photo by Michael M. Santiago / POOL / AFP) (Photo by MICHAEL M. SANTIAGO/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Prosecutors tell jurors to set aside Trump's 'likability' during trial
item.dc:creator: Adam Reiss and Dareh Gregorian and Jonathan Allen and Lisa Rubin
item.description: The first jurors were selected for Donald Trump’s hush money trial Tuesday amid a battle over prospective jurors’ old Facebook posts and calls to “lock him up” and a judge’s warning that the former president should not try to intimidate the panelists who will be deciding his fate.

media:content.media:text: politics political politician
media:content.media:description: In this courtroom sketch, former President Donald Trump smiles to the jury pool as he is introduced to them at the beginning of his trial over charges that he falsified business records to conceal money paid to silence porn star Stormy Daniels in 2016, in Manhattan state court in New York, Monday, on April 15, 2024.

item.title: Trump's trial: A 'freak show' on the outside and solemn on the inside
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Allen
item.description: Inside a courthouse nestled between Tribeca and Chinatown on Monday morning, former President Donald Trump's lawyers argued with the district attorney's office over procedures for a hush-money case that could send an ex-commander in chief to prison for the first time in American history.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump sits in the courtroom
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump at Manhattan criminal court in New York on Monday.

item.title: An uneasy alliance of Arab states helped to defend Israel from Iran. Their resolve may soon be tested.
item.dc:creator: Matt Bradley
item.description: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Jordan helped to defend Israel from missile and drone attacks by Iran. Their resolve may soon be tested.

media:content.media:text: Jordan's King Abdullah meets with U.S. President Biden at the White House in Washington
media:content.media:description: Jordan's King Abdullah speaking alongside President Biden at the White House on Feb. 12, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Jordan's council of ministers said the armed forces intercepted 'flying objects' which breached its airspace.
media:content.media:description: Onlookers and security agents stand around the debris of a missile that the Jordanian forces intercepted over Amman.

media:content.media:text: People protest in support of Palestinians in Gaza, in Amman
media:content.media:description: People march through the streets of the Jordanian capital Amman in support of Palestinians in Gaza.

item.title: Gap between Caitlin Clark's WNBA salary and her male counterparts draws outrage
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang
item.description: College basketball superstar Caitlin Clark is set to soar to new heights in the WNBA — but her rookie contract will see her pocket a mere fraction of the millions her male counterparts have cashed in on the court.

media:content.media:text: Caitlin Clark
media:content.media:description: Caitlin Clark of the Iowa Hawkeyes during the 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament National Championship against the South Carolina Gamecocks in Cleveland on April 7.

item.title: The Mexican state closest to Arizona bans most abortions, creating a regional void
item.dc:creator: Isabela Espadas Barros Leal and Albinson Linares
item.description: The Mexican state of Sonora bans abortion with minimal exceptions unlike other Mexican states, meaning that impending abortion restrictions in Arizona will create a regional lack of access for women on both sides of the border.

media:content.media:text: A worker paints over a graffiti that reads "legal abortion" following demonstrations
media:content.media:description: A University of Sonora employee paints over graffiti on the university's museum and public library after International Women's Day demonstrations in Hermosillo, Mexico, in 2021.

item.title: Verified pro-Nazi X accounts flourish under Elon Musk
item.dc:creator: David Ingram and Lora Kolodny, CNBC
item.description: Elon Musk’s X is a thriving hub for Nazi support and propaganda, with paid subscribers sharing speeches by Hitler or content praising his genocidal regime.

media:content.media:text: Photo illustration/collage of Elon Musk and various tweets detailing X's violent speech policy
media:content.media:description: Policies that could apply to pro-Nazi content on X don’t appear to be applied consistently.

item.title: 'Give them a verbal hug': Emails show how the Navy scrambled to manage a spate of suicides
item.dc:creator: Melissa Chan
item.description: As the USS George Washington reeled from a spate of suicides two years ago, Navy leaders reacted with anger and denial while discussing news coverage of the deaths and whether to promote the sailors posthumously, according to emails obtained by NBC News.

media:content.media:text: Photo illustration of silhouette of navy soldier with excerpts of emails overlaid atop it
media:content.media:description: Emails obtained by NBC News show how Navy leadership responded following a spate of suicides by sailors assigned to the USS George Washington in Virginia.

media:content.media:credit: USS George H.W. Bush via Getty Images
media:content.media:text: US aircraft carrier USS George Washington
media:content.media:description: The USS George Washington during its mission in the eastern Mediterranean Sea in 2017.

media:content.media:text: Image: Mika’il Rayshawn Sharp
media:content.media:description: Mika’il Sharp.

media:content.media:text: Natasha Huffman.
media:content.media:description: Natasha Huffman.

media:content.media:text: Xavier Hunter Sandor.
media:content.media:description: Xavier Sandor.

media:content.media:text: Xavier Hunter Sandor with his father, John Sandor.
media:content.media:description: Xavier Sandor with his father, John Sandor.

item.title: House delivers articles of impeachment against Secy. Mayorkas to the Senate
item.description: Republican members of the House of Representatives walked through the capitol to deliver articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secy. Alejandro Mayorkas to the Senate. NBC News' Ali Vitali has details on how the House came to this action and what may come next.

media:content.media:title: House delivers articles of impeachment against Secy. Mayorkas to the Senate
media:content.media:description: Republican members of the House of Representatives walked through the capitol to deliver articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secy. Alejandro Mayorkas to the Senate. NBC News' Ali Vitali has details on how the House came to this action and what may come next.

item.title: Kari Lake suggests supporters 'strap on a Glock' to be ready for 2024
item.dc:creator: Alex Tabet
item.description: Arizona GOP Senate hopeful Kari Lake referenced carrying guns and urged military and law enforcement veterans to be “ready” for the next six months.

media:content.media:text: Kari Lake Speaks At CPAC 2023
media:content.media:description: Kari Lake at CPAC in Oxon Hill, Md., on March 4, 2023.

item.title: Control of Michigan state House at stake in a pair of special elections
item.dc:creator: Adam Edelman
item.description: Voters in Michigan will head to the polls Tuesday for a pair of state House special elections that will determine partisan control of the chamber.

media:content.media:text: State Capitol of Michigan in Lansing
media:content.media:description: Two special elections Tuesday will determine which party controls the Michigan state House.

item.title: Three takeaways as Democratic donors pour cash into fight for Senate
item.dc:creator: Bridget Bowman and Joe Murphy and Ben Kamisar
item.description: Democrats face an uphill battle to keep control of the Senate, but new fundraising reports show they are building up an early cash advantage for the fight.

media:content.media:text: Sen. Sherrod Brown, D-Ohio
media:content.media:description: Sen. Sherrod Brown, D-Ohio, in the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 23.

item.title: Object that crashed into Florida home came from space station, NASA confirms
item.dc:creator: Denise Chow
item.description: A piece of metal that crashed through a Florida home was a piece of space junk from the International Space Station, according to NASA.

media:content.media:text: Recovered stanchion from the NASA flight support equipment used to mount International Space Station batteries on a cargo pallet. The stanchion survived re-entry through Earth’s atmosphere on March 8, 2024, and impacted a home in Naples, Fla.
media:content.media:description: Recovered stanchion from the NASA flight support equipment used to mount International Space Station batteries on a cargo pallet. The stanchion survived re-entry through Earth’s atmosphere on March 8, 2024, and impacted a home in Naples, Fla.

item.title: India's Prime Minister Modi taps U.S. diaspora to drum up support at home
item.dc:creator: Mithil Aggarwal and Megan Lebowitz
item.description: India's election will last six weeks after a campaign that has sprawled across India — and into the United States as well.

media:content.media:text: Overseas Friends of Bharatiya Janata Party-USA campaign event
media:content.media:description: Karthik Rangarajan speaks during an Overseas Friends of Bharatiya Janata Party-USA campaign event in Potomac, Md., last month.

media:content.media:text: Overseas Friends of Bharatiya Janata Party-USA campaign event
media:content.media:description: Many of the attendees at the event wore scarves of saffron, a color associated with the Hindu nationalist movement.

media:content.media:text: India Prepares For First Phase Of General Elections
media:content.media:description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at a campaign rally in Mysuru, India, on Sunday.

item.title: Sydney stabbing assailant's parents say he was a 'very sick boy'
item.description: The man who fatally stabbed six people at a mall in Sydney had a long history of mental illness and frustrations with women, his father told Australian media. Andrew Cauchi said he was devastated by news that his son, Joel, had killed people at a mall in Sydney’s beachside suburb of Bondi and apologized for his son's actions.

media:content.media:title: Sydney stabbing assailant's parents say he was a 'very sick boy'
media:content.media:description: The man who fatally stabbed six people at a mall in Sydney had a long history of mental illness and frustrations with women, his father told Australian media. Andrew Cauchi said he was devastated by news that his son, Joel, had killed people at a mall in Sydney’s beachside suburb of Bondi and apologized for his son's actions.

item.title: Fed Chair Powell says there has been a 'lack of further progress' this year on inflation
item.dc:creator: Jeff Cox, CNBC
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Tuesday that the U.S. economy, while otherwise strong, has not seen inflation come back to the central bank’s goal, pointing to the further unlikelihood that interest rate cuts are in the offing anytime soon.

media:content.media:text: Jerome Powell speaks during the Stanford Business, Government and Society Forum
media:content.media:description: Federal Reserve Bank Chair Jerome Powell at a forum at Stanford University in Stanford, Calif., on April 3.

item.title: Lawmakers seek disavowal of Supreme Court's racist 'Insular Cases' that limited rights of people in U.S. territories
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Hurley
item.description: Lawmakers join a renewed push for the Justice Department to condemn racist Supreme Court "Insular Cases" rulings that deprived U.S. territories of equal rights.

media:content.media:text: A woman waves the flag of Puerto Rico
media:content.media:description: A woman waves the flag of Puerto Rico during a news conference on Puerto Rican statehood on Capitol Hill in 2021.

item.title: Federal appeals court overturns West Virginia's transgender sports ban
item.dc:creator: Matt Lavietes
item.description: A federal appeals court struck down a West Virginia law that barred transgender athletes from competing on girls’ and women’s sports teams in public schools and colleges.

item.title: Fake Botox is the cause of bad reactions in 9 states, FDA says
item.dc:creator: Erika Edwards
item.description: Fake Botox is behind 19 reports of vision problems and difficulty breathing and swallowing in at least nine states, the Food and Drug Administration said Tuesday.

media:content.media:text: Counterfeit version of Botox on a blue background
media:content.media:description: An example of a counterfeit version of Botox.
